Posts.Content: Nov 23, 2009 05:09PM Regawhatever wrote: Everyone here has given you great advice so far, so I'll just add the one thing I wish I knew in the early days of Cancerland: You won't always be this scared. You won't always wake up and have cancer be the first thing on your mind. You will get through this. It might even make you a stronger person. I was 35 when I was diagnosed and I thought it was the end of the world. In some ways it was, but now I'm so much more grateful for every moment I can spend with my kids and family. Ask lots of questions -- and come over to the IDC board too when you're ready. -Tricia
Posts.Title: Holding my breath. Emme Kyta
